FuncDef:
The ssl-policy name command configures an SSL policy for the BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP).
The undo ssl-policy name command deletes the SSL policy configured for BMP. The ssl-policy name command configures an SSL policy for the BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP). The undo ssl-policy name command deletes the SSL policy configured for BMP. By default, no SSL policy is configured for BMP.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an SSL policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 23 case-insensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Examples: Warning: The SSL policy is bound to the default PKI domain, Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo: The Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocol protects data privacy on the Internet by preventing attackers from eavesdropping on data exchanged between a client and a server. Specifically, to ensure data transmission security on a network, an SSL policy needs to be configured for BMP using the ssl-policy name command to associate BMP with the SSL policy, and the SSL data encryption, identity authentication, and message integrity verification mechanisms need to be used.
